Title: (Updated) Microsoft Teams: New town hall event access policy
Short description: stayInformed; Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Official Roadmap link: Microsoft Teams is updating its town hall event access policy. Admins can now control who can attend town halls with the new `TownhallEventAttendeeAccess` setting. The rollout will occur from mid to late June 2025. The default setting is `Everyone`, but it can be changed using Microsoft PowerShell. More details are available [here](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&searchterms=483250).

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Purview: New Purview Data Security Investigations (DSI) solution
Short description: stayInformed; Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Official Roadmap link: Microsoft Purview Data Security Investigations (DSI) is an AI-powered solution for data security teams to identify, analyze, and mitigate risks. Public Preview starts in April 2025, with General Availability in August 2025. DSI helps locate and analyze data, visualize correlations, and refine security policies. Learn more [here](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft-security-blog/accelerate-data-security-investigations-with-ai-powered-deep-content-analysis/4396099).

Title: Microsoft Exchange Online: New Reject Direct Send parameter (preview)
Short description: stayInformed; New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Official Roadmap link: Microsoft Exchange Online introduces a new "Reject Direct Send" parameter to block unwanted Direct Send traffic. Public Preview is available now, with General Availability in September 2025. Admins can enable this feature using PowerShell. Review configurations and notify users. Learn more [here](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/exchange/introducing-more-control-over-direct-send-in-exchange-online/4408790).

Title: Intune policy to determine SMIME cert lookup priority
Short description: planForChange; New feature, Admin impact
Official Roadmap link: A new Intune policy allows admins to set the priority order for SMIME certificate lookup in Outlook mobile, enhancing control and security. Rolling out on August 29, 2025, it is off by default. Configuration details and examples are provided. More information is available [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/clients-and-mobile-in-exchange-online/outlook-for-ios-and-android/outlook-for-ios-and-android-configuration-with-microsoft-intune#smime-settings).

Title: (Updated) Missed Activity Emails for Teams Will Now Come from a Unified Domain
Short description: stayInformed; Updated message, Feature update, User impact
Official Roadmap link: Missed activity emails for Microsoft Teams will now come from ‘no-reply@teams.mail.microsoft’ instead of ‘noreply@*email.teams.microsoft.com’. This change aims for a consistent and secure email experience and will roll out in July 2025. No action is required from users or admins.

Title: Take actions with Viva Pulse after Viva Glint engagement surveys is now GA!
Short description: stayInformed; Feature update, User impact
Official Roadmap link: Viva Pulse now integrates with Viva Glint, allowing managers to take targeted actions after Glint engagement surveys. This feature is available to Viva Glint customers with eligible licenses and must be enabled by a Glint admin. It helps maintain engagement momentum by recommending Pulse questions based on Glint survey results. Learn more [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/viva/pulse/viva-integrations/take-actions-after-glint-survey).

Title: (Updated) Teams admin center: App centric management and changes to app permission policies
Short description: planForChange; Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Official Roadmap link: Teams admin center is updating to app-centric management with three phases: Phase 1 (auto-migration for single policy customers) is complete. Phase 2 (self-migration) is extended to mid-May 2025. Phase 3 (auto-migration for remaining customers) starts mid-April and ends June 2025. Detailed documentation is available [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/app-centric-management).
